lead_paragraph: Usain Bolt of Jamaica, the 100-meter world-record holder, expressed his fears that the injuries that had affected his two main rivals for the Olympic title would hit him with just under a month to go before the Beijing Games. Bolt said the hamstring injury sustained by the United States 100-meter champion Tyson Gay and the minor groin problem his Jamaican teammate Asafa Powell pulled up with in Rome on Friday had him worried.
